greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Position in the sequence of numbers that are not perfect powers (A007916) of the smallest positive integer x such that for some positive integer y we have n = x^y (A052410).
comment: Every pair p of positive integers is of the form p = (a(n), A052409(n)) for exactly one n.
formula: For n>1 we have a(n) = A278028(n,1).
example: a(27)=2 because the smallest root of 27 is 3, and 3 is the 2nd entry of A007916.
a(25)=3 because the smallest root of 25 is 5, and 5 is the 3rd entry of A007916.
program: (PARI) a(n) = if (ispower(n,,&r), x = r, x = n); sum(k=2, x, ispower(k)==0); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 19 2017
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 22 2017
